intro: Wilczekra congolensis, commonly known as the Congo wilczekra, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
